meanings.definition: To produce a greater yield than something else.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree outyields the orange tree in fruit production.
meanings.sent2: The new farming technique consistently outyields the traditional methods.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the two farmers led to a bet on whose crop would outyields the other.
meanings.sent4: The student's dedication and hard work outyields natural talent in academic success.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outyields the daisy in attracting bees with its bright petals.

meanings.sent1: The new hybrid car model outyields all others in fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The innovative technology outyields the outdated machinery in productivity.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver's skills outyields his competitors on the track.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination outyields his opponents in every race.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's strength outyields any villain's power in the comic book world.
